column4: I have a question. Does anyone know how to run Eclipse (the Java IDE) in Ubuntu?
you should just be able to install it through software center and run it from the menu
thanks, I was trying to download and install it from the web. I just switched to Linux a week or so ago and am just learning the ropes.
welcome to linux!  Your first bet for any software is to search the software center (or Synaptic).  You'll be surprised at how much is there!
I'll keep that in mind. I'm going to stay in here till I'm sure it installed properly, then I'll skeddadle.
Bpendragon...let me know if you need help
got it installed, I need to install a specific .jar file, where do I put it on the computer?
if you installed it through the software center, it should be in your menus and ready to go
it's not available through the software center. Any ideas?
Bpendragon...sure, open up a terminal and type "sudo apt-get install eclipse"

wait... I'm past that. I have eclipse up and running. But I need to get a specific  .jar file available. On windows and mac there's a specific folder you place it in, I was wondering if the same was true for ubuntu, and if so, where
Bpendragon...I'm not sure...what are you trying to do with the jar file?
I need it to be able to use the classes in it, for a class on introductory Java I'm in
Bpendragon...you can do that from within eclipse IIRC
let me fire it up and check
you shoudl be able to save the file to your home directory or your desktop, then import it using File -> Import in eclipse
